Package me.hapyl.spigotutils.module.annotate

Annotation Interface ArgumentSensitive

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(METHOD) public @interface ArgumentSensitive
Indicates that the annotated method can be targeted by CommandProcessor to call it if targetSize() and targetString() matches to execute it. Notice that annotated method must be a member of SimpleCommand class and must have exactly two arguments where first is CommandSender and the second is String! Example: @ArgumentSensitive(targetSize=0, targetString="hello") public void myMethod(CommandSender sender, String[] args) { sender.sendMessage("argument sensitive method works"); } Example method will be executed if command is executed with "hello" as it's first argument (args[0]) after execution of the command itself.
